author: gdaniels
msg: Submit release plan for future reference.  These docs (requirements,
release plan) should probably move somewhere else...

author: gdaniels
msg: List is "|" separated, not space-separated.

author: gdaniels
msg: Use new API, don't overwrite property.

author: gdaniels
msg: Flesh out transport stuff a bit.
There's now a static initialize() method on ServiceClient (not necessarily
the best place for it) which someone should be responsible for calling
before parsing any URLs - it sets up the basic Axis transports (http and
local) and registers the org.apache.axis.transports class in the URL
search path.
Move HTTPTransport into org.apache.axis.transport.http
Add local transport support classes.  "local://" URLs work now.

author: gdaniels
msg: Fix TCP samples + functional tests.
Despite Sam's foreboding, I'm putting in the beginnings of an architecture
that lets us use custom URL StreamFactories for transport-specific URLs.
ServiceClient currently has a (static) registry of protocols (Strings) to
Transports.  If you want to use this, you need to set the system property
java.protocol.handler.pkgs to an appopriate place.  Next step is to make
sure we don't actually stomp the value of this property, just append to it.
The AdminClient in samples.transport.tcp now works for http OR tcp,
depending on the URL you pass in.
Unbelievably, I can now actually run the functional tests to successful
completion.  Yow!
